Package gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.polygon

Interface Polygon

All Known Implementing Classes:
Ellipse, Polygon2D, Polygon3D, PolygonGlobal, PolygonPoints, SmallCircle
public interface Polygon
This Polygon Interface is implemented by two derived classes: Polygon2D and Polygon3D. This interface provides a number of static methods for reading and writing Polygon2D and Polygon3D objects. They can be read/written to ascii files, binary files, kml/kmz files and vtk files.
Author:
sballar

    • getPolygon

      static Polygon getPolygon(File inputFile) throws Exception
      Retrieve a single Polygon from an ascii file. If the extension is kml or kmz (case insensitive) then a single polygon is loaded from a Google Earth file.
      Parameters:
      inputFile -
      Returns:
      Throws:
      Exception

      static List<Polygon> getPolygonList(File inputFile) throws Exception

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • getPolygon

      static Polygon getPolygon(DataInputStream input) throws EOFException, Exception
      Static method that reads the class name from the input stream and then constructs a Polygon of that type and returns it. Recognized types include PolygonGlobal, SmallCircle, PolygonPoints and Polygon3D
      Parameters:
      input -
      Returns:
      one of the derived Polygon classes
      Throws:
      Exception
      EOFException

      void invert()
      Invert the current polygon. What used to be in will be out and what used to be out will be in.

    • overlaps

      boolean overlaps(Polygon other) throws Exception
      Returns true if this Polygon and some other Polygon overlap. Note that it is possible for two polygons to overlap even when neither Polygon contains any of the points that define the other Polygon.
      Parameters:
      other -
      Returns:
      Throws:
      Exception

    • write

      void write(File fileName) throws Exception
      Write the current polygon to a file. If the file extension is 'vtk' then the file is written in vtk format. If the file extension is 'kml' or 'kmz' the file is written in a format compatible with Google Earth. Otherwise the file is written in ascii format with boundary points written in lat-lon order.
      Parameters:
      fileName - name of file to receive the polygon
      Throws:
      Exception

    • writeBinary

      void writeBinary(File fileName) throws Exception
      Write the current polygon to a file in binary format.
      Parameters:
      fileName -
      Throws:
      Exception

    • write

      void write(Writer output) throws Exception
      Write the current polygon to a file in ascii format.
      Parameters:
      fileName - name of file to receive the polygon
      latLon - if this String starts with 'lon' the polygon boundary points will be written in lon-lat order otherwise they will be written in lat-lon order.
      Throws:
      Exception

      Throws:
      Exception

    • getPoints

      double[][] getPoints(boolean repeatFirstPoint) throws Exception
      Retrieve a deep copy of the points on the polygon.
      Parameters:
      repeatFirstPoint - if true, last point will be reference to the same point as the first point.
      Returns:
      a deep copy of the points on the polygon.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • getPoints

      double[][] getPoints(boolean repeatFirstPoint, double maxSpacing) throws Exception
      Retrieve a deep copy of the points on the polygon.
      Parameters:
      repeatFirstPoint - if true, last point will be reference to the same point as the first point.
      maxSpacing - max distance between points, in radians
      Returns:
      a deep copy of the points on the polygon.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • getArea

      double getArea() throws Exception
      Retrieve the area of this polygon. This is the unitless area (radians squared). To convert to km^2, multiply the result by R^2 where R is the radius of the sphere. The range is zero to 4*PI.
      Returns:
      Throws:
      Exception

    • size

      int size()
      Returns the number of edges that define the polygon. Equals the number of unique GeoVectors that define the polygon.
      Returns:
      the number of edges that define the polygon. Equals the number of unique GeoVectors that define the polygon.

    • setAttachment

      void setAttachment(Object attachment)

    • getAttachment

      Object getAttachment()

    • contains

      ArrayList<Boolean> contains(List<double[]> points, int nProcessors) throws Exception
      Determine if a list of unit vectors is contained within this polygon. Concurrency is used to process batches of points in parallel.
      Parameters:
      points - list of points to evaluate
      nProcessors - number of processors to use in concurrent mode. If nProcessors < 2, points are evaluated in sequential mode.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of length equal to input points.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • contains

      HashMap<double[],Boolean> contains(Set<double[]> points, int nProcessors) throws Exception
      Determine if a set of unit vectors is contained within this polygon. Concurrency is used to process batches of points in parallel.
      Parameters:
      points - set of points to evaluate
      nProcessors - number of processors to use in concurrent mode. If nProcessors < 2, points are evaluated in sequential mode.
      Returns:
      HashMap<double[], Boolean> of length equal to input points.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • contains

      void contains(Map<double[],Boolean> points, int nProcessors) throws Exception
      Determine if a set of unit vectors is contained within this polygon. Concurrency is used to process batches of points in parallel.
      Parameters:
      points - map from unit vector to boolean containing points to evaluate. Only points where getValue() == null are evaluated. If a point has getValue() = true or false, it is assumed that the point has already been evaluated and it is not evaluated again.
      nProcessors - number of processors to use in concurrent mode. If nProcessors < 2, points are evaluated in sequential mode.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • getTop

      Horizon getTop()
      If this is a Polygon3D, returns the Horizon object that defines the 'top' of the Polygon
      Returns:
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if this is not a Polygon3D

      Throws:

    • containsAll

      boolean containsAll(ArrayList<double[]> points, ArrayList<Double> radii, ArrayList<Integer> layers, ArrayList<double[]> layerRadii) throws Exception
      Returns true if this Polygon contains all of the supplied points
      Parameters:
      points - array of unit vectors
      radii - the radii of the positions of the points. Array must have same number of elements as points.
      layers - the layer index of each point.
      layerRadii - the radii of the interfaces that define the layers at each point. This is an nPoints by nLayers+1 array, where nPoints is the number of points in the points array, and nLayers is the number of layers in the model.
      Returns:
      true if this Polygon contains all of the supplied points
      Throws:
      Exception
      UnsupportedOperationException - if this is not a Polygon3D

    • containsAny

      boolean containsAny(ArrayList<double[]> points, ArrayList<Double> radii, ArrayList<Integer> layers, ArrayList<double[]> layerRadii) throws Exception
      Returns true if this Polygon contains any of the supplied points
      Parameters:
      points - array of unit vectors
      radii - the radii of the positions of the points. Array must have same number of elements as points.
      layers - the layer index of each point.
      layerRadii - the radii of the interfaces that define the layers at each point. This is an nPoints by nLayers+1 array, where nPoints is the number of points in the points array, and nLayers is the number of layers in the model.
      Returns:
      true if this Polygon contains any of the supplied points
      Throws:
      Exception
      UnsupportedOperationException - if this is not a Polygon3D

      boolean containsAny(double[][] points, double[] radii, int[] layers, double[][] layerRadii) throws Exception
